Lecture 04.01: Completeness and Baire Category Theorem

Completeness and Baire Category Theorem

ğŸ“– Tá»•ng quan

Completeness lÃ  má»™t trong nhá»¯ng khÃ¡i niá»‡m quan trá»ng nháº¥t trong giáº£i tÃ­ch vÃ  tÃ´-pÃ´ há»c. Trá»±c giÃ¡c Ä‘áº±ng sau completeness lÃ  Ä‘Æ¡n giáº£n nhÆ°ng sÃ¢u sáº¯c: má»™t khÃ´ng gian metric lÃ  complete náº¿u nÃ³ â€œkhÃ´ng cÃ³ lá»— há»•ngâ€â€”má»i dÃ£y Cauchy (nhá»¯ng dÃ£y mÃ  cÃ¡c pháº§n tá»­ gáº§n nhau tÃ¹y Ã½) Ä‘á»u há»™i tá»¥ Ä‘áº¿n má»™t Ä‘iá»ƒm trong khÃ´ng gian. Äiá»u nÃ y Ä‘áº£m báº£o ráº±ng khÃ´ng gian khÃ´ng cÃ³ â€œÄ‘iá»ƒm thiáº¿uâ€â€”má»i Ä‘iá»ƒm mÃ  chÃºng ta mong Ä‘á»£i tá»“n táº¡i Ä‘á»u thá»±c sá»± tá»“n táº¡i.

Äá»‹nh lÃ½ Baire Category lÃ  má»™t trong nhá»¯ng Ä‘á»‹nh lÃ½ Ä‘áº¹p vÃ  máº¡nh máº½ nháº¥t trong tÃ´-pÃ´ há»c. NÃ³ phÃ¡t biá»ƒu ráº±ng má»™t complete metric space khÃ´ng thá»ƒ Ä‘Æ°á»£c viáº¿t thÃ nh há»£p Ä‘áº¿m Ä‘Æ°á»£c cá»§a cÃ¡c táº­p nowhere dense. Nghe cÃ³ váº» ká»¹ thuáº­t? NhÆ°ng cÃ¡c há»‡ quáº£ cá»§a nÃ³ ráº¥t sÃ¢u sáº¯c! Äá»‹nh lÃ½ nÃ y cho chÃºng ta biáº¿t ráº±ng complete metric spaces lÃ  â€œlá»›nâ€ theo má»™t nghÄ©a nháº¥t Ä‘á»‹nhâ€”chÃºng khÃ´ng thá»ƒ Ä‘Æ°á»£c phÃ¢n tÃ­ch thÃ nh cÃ¡c pháº§n â€œnhá»â€ theo nghÄ©a Baire.


DÃ£y Cauchy trong complete space há»™i tá»¥ - Nguá»“n: Wikimedia Commons

Táº¡i sao completeness vÃ  Ä‘á»‹nh lÃ½ Baire láº¡i quan trá»ng Ä‘áº¿n váº­y? Thá»© nháº¥t, cÃ¡c Ä‘á»‹nh lÃ½ Ä‘iá»ƒm báº¥t Ä‘á»™ng nhÆ° Ä‘á»‹nh lÃ½ Banach vÃ  Ä‘á»‹nh lÃ½ Brouwer Ä‘á»u cáº§n completeness Ä‘á»ƒ hoáº¡t Ä‘á»™ngâ€”chÃºng Ä‘áº£m báº£o ráº±ng cÃ¡c dÃ£y láº·p há»™i tá»¥ Ä‘áº¿n Ä‘iá»ƒm báº¥t Ä‘á»™ng. Thá»© hai, trong giáº£i tÃ­ch hÃ m, cÃ¡c Banach spaces Ä‘Æ°á»£c Ä‘á»‹nh nghÄ©a chÃ­nh xÃ¡c lÃ  cÃ¡c khÃ´ng gian Ä‘á»‹nh chuáº©n completeâ€”Ä‘Ã¢y lÃ  ná»n táº£ng cá»§a toÃ n bá»™ lÄ©nh vá»±c giáº£i tÃ­ch hÃ m. Thá»© ba, nhiá»u Ä‘á»‹nh lÃ½ tá»“n táº¡i trong giáº£i tÃ­ch dá»±a vÃ o Ä‘á»‹nh lÃ½ Baire Ä‘á»ƒ chá»©ng minh sá»± tá»“n táº¡i cá»§a cÃ¡c Ä‘á»‘i tÆ°á»£ng â€œgenericâ€â€”nhá»¯ng Ä‘á»‘i tÆ°á»£ng cÃ³ cÃ¡c tÃ­nh cháº¥t Ä‘áº·c biá»‡t mÃ  háº§u háº¿t cÃ¡c Ä‘á»‘i tÆ°á»£ng Ä‘á»u cÃ³. Cuá»‘i cÃ¹ng, Ä‘á»‹nh lÃ½ Baire cho chÃºng ta nhá»¯ng káº¿t quáº£ pháº£n trá»±c giÃ¡c: má»™t táº­p cÃ³ thá»ƒ dense (dÃ y Ä‘áº·c) nhÆ°ng láº¡i meager (nhá» theo nghÄ©a Baire), nhÆ° trÆ°á»ng há»£p cá»§a $\mathbb{Q}$ trong $\mathbb{R}$.

Trong bÃ i há»c nÃ y, chÃºng ta sáº½ khÃ¡m phÃ¡ cÃ¡c khÃ¡i niá»‡m cÆ¡ báº£n cá»§a completeness vÃ  Ä‘á»‹nh lÃ½ Baire Category. ChÃºng ta báº¯t Ä‘áº§u vá»›i Ä‘á»‹nh nghÄ©a cá»§a complete spaces vÃ  cÃ¡c vÃ­ dá»¥ quan trá»ng nhÆ° $\mathbb{R}^n$, cÃ¡c khoáº£ng Ä‘Ã³ng, vÃ  cÃ¡c khÃ´ng gian hÃ m. ChÃºng ta sáº½ nghiÃªn cá»©u cÃ¡c tÃ­nh cháº¥t cá»§a complete spaces, bao gá»“m cÃ¡ch completeness Ä‘Æ°á»£c báº£o toÃ n bá»Ÿi cÃ¡c khÃ´ng gian con Ä‘Ã³ng. ChÃºng ta sáº½ khÃ¡m phÃ¡ khÃ¡i niá»‡m completionâ€”má»i metric space Ä‘á»u cÃ³ má»™t completion duy nháº¥t (lÃªn Ä‘áº¿n isometry), giá»‘ng nhÆ° cÃ¡ch $\mathbb{R}$ lÃ  completion cá»§a $\mathbb{Q}$. ChÃºng ta sáº½ Ä‘á»‹nh nghÄ©a cÃ¡c táº­p nowhere dense vÃ  cÃ¡c khÃ¡i niá»‡m meager vÃ  residual. Cuá»‘i cÃ¹ng, chÃºng ta sáº½ phÃ¡t biá»ƒu vÃ  chá»©ng minh Ä‘á»‹nh lÃ½ Baire Category, vÃ  khÃ¡m phÃ¡ cÃ¡c á»©ng dá»¥ng cá»§a nÃ³ trong giáº£i tÃ­ch hÃ m vÃ  cÃ¡c Ä‘á»‹nh lÃ½ tá»“n táº¡i.

ğŸ” Complete Metric Spaces

1. Definition vÃ  First Properties

TrÆ°á»›c khi Ä‘á»‹nh nghÄ©a completeness, chÃºng ta cáº§n nháº¯c láº¡i khÃ¡i niá»‡m vá» dÃ£y Cauchy. Má»™t dÃ£y $(x_n)$ trong metric space $(X, d)$ Ä‘Æ°á»£c gá»i lÃ  Cauchy náº¿u cÃ¡c pháº§n tá»­ cá»§a nÃ³ gáº§n nhau tÃ¹y Ã½ khi chá»‰ sá»‘ Ä‘á»§ lá»›n. ChÃ­nh xÃ¡c hÆ¡n, $(x_n)$ lÃ  Cauchy náº¿u:

\[\forall \varepsilon > 0: \exists N \in \mathbb{N}: \forall m,n \geq N: d(x_m, x_n) < \varepsilon\]

Trá»±c giÃ¡c Ä‘áº±ng sau khÃ¡i niá»‡m nÃ y lÃ : má»™t dÃ£y Cauchy lÃ  má»™t dÃ£y mÃ  cÃ¡c pháº§n tá»­ cá»§a nÃ³ â€œmuá»‘n há»™i tá»¥â€â€”chÃºng gáº§n nhau tÃ¹y Ã½â€”nhÆ°ng Ä‘iá»ƒm giá»›i háº¡n cÃ³ thá»ƒ khÃ´ng tá»“n táº¡i trong khÃ´ng gian.

Äá»‹nh nghÄ©a (Complete Metric Space):
Má»™t metric space $(X, d)$ Ä‘Æ°á»£c gá»i lÃ  complete náº¿u má»i dÃ£y Cauchy trong $X$ Ä‘á»u há»™i tá»¥ Ä‘áº¿n má»™t Ä‘iá»ƒm trong $X$.

Trá»±c giÃ¡c Ä‘áº±ng sau completeness lÃ  â€œkhÃ´ng cÃ³ lá»— há»•ngâ€â€”má»i Ä‘iá»ƒm mÃ  chÃºng ta mong Ä‘á»£i tá»“n táº¡i (nhÆ° giá»›i háº¡n cá»§a má»™t dÃ£y Cauchy) Ä‘á»u thá»±c sá»± tá»“n táº¡i trong khÃ´ng gian. ÄÃ¢y lÃ  má»™t tÃ­nh cháº¥t quan trá»ng Ä‘áº£m báº£o ráº±ng khÃ´ng gian khÃ´ng cÃ³ â€œÄ‘iá»ƒm thiáº¿uâ€.

Má»™t káº¿t quáº£ cÆ¡ báº£n lÃ  má»i dÃ£y há»™i tá»¥ Ä‘á»u lÃ  Cauchy. Äiá»u nÃ y cÃ³ nghÄ©a lÃ  náº¿u $x_n \to x$, thÃ¬ vá»›i má»i $\varepsilon > 0$, tá»“n táº¡i $N$ sao cho vá»›i má»i $n \geq N$, ta cÃ³ $d(x_n, x) < \varepsilon/2$. Khi Ä‘Ã³, vá»›i má»i $m, n \geq N$, ta cÃ³:

\[d(x_m, x_n) \leq d(x_m, x) + d(x, x_n) < \frac{\varepsilon}{2} + \frac{\varepsilon}{2} = \varepsilon\]

Váº­y $(x_n)$ lÃ  Cauchy. Tuy nhiÃªn, Ä‘iá»u ngÆ°á»£c láº¡i khÃ´ng Ä‘Ãºng trong trÆ°á»ng há»£p tá»•ng quÃ¡tâ€”má»™t dÃ£y Cauchy khÃ´ng nháº¥t thiáº¿t pháº£i há»™i tá»¥. NhÆ°ng náº¿u khÃ´ng gian lÃ  complete, thÃ¬ má»i dÃ£y Cauchy Ä‘á»u há»™i tá»¥â€”Ä‘Ã¢y chÃ­nh lÃ  Ä‘á»‹nh nghÄ©a cá»§a completeness.

2. Examples cá»§a Complete Spaces

Má»™t trong nhá»¯ng vÃ­ dá»¥ quan trá»ng nháº¥t cá»§a complete space lÃ  khÃ´ng gian Euclid $\mathbb{R}^n$ vá»›i metric Euclid thÃ´ng thÆ°á»ng. Äá»‹nh lÃ½ phÃ¡t biá»ƒu ráº±ng $(\mathbb{R}^n, d_2)$ lÃ  complete. Ã tÆ°á»Ÿng chá»©ng minh lÃ  nhÆ° sau: náº¿u $(x_n)$ lÃ  má»™t dÃ£y Cauchy trong $\mathbb{R}^n$, thÃ¬ má»—i tá»a Ä‘á»™ cá»§a nÃ³ lÃ  má»™t dÃ£y Cauchy trong $\mathbb{R}$. VÃ¬ $\mathbb{R}$ lÃ  complete (theo tiÃªn Ä‘á» completeness cá»§a sá»‘ thá»±c), má»—i tá»a Ä‘á»™ há»™i tá»¥. Do Ä‘Ã³, giá»›i háº¡n $x = (\lim x_1^n, \ldots, \lim x_n^n)$ tá»“n táº¡i vÃ  $x_n \to x$ trong $\mathbb{R}^n$. Äiá»u quan trá»ng lÃ  completeness cá»§a $\mathbb{R}$ lÃ  ná»n táº£ng cho táº¥t cáº£ cÃ¡c káº¿t quáº£ nÃ yâ€”Ä‘Ã¢y lÃ  má»™t trong nhá»¯ng lÃ½ do táº¡i sao chÃºng ta cáº§n sá»‘ thá»±c thay vÃ¬ chá»‰ sá»‘ há»¯u tá»‰.

Má»™t vÃ­ dá»¥ quan trá»ng khÃ¡c lÃ  khoáº£ng Ä‘Ã³ng $[a,b]$. Äá»‹nh lÃ½ phÃ¡t biá»ƒu ráº±ng khoáº£ng Ä‘Ã³ng bá»‹ cháº·n $[a,b]$ lÃ  complete. Chá»©ng minh nhÆ° sau: náº¿u $(x_n)$ lÃ  má»™t dÃ£y Cauchy trong $[a,b] \subseteq \mathbb{R}$, thÃ¬ vÃ¬ $\mathbb{R}$ lÃ  complete, $x_n \to x \in \mathbb{R}$. VÃ¬ $[a,b]$ lÃ  Ä‘Ã³ng trong $\mathbb{R}$, ta cÃ³ $x \in [a,b]$. NguyÃªn lÃ½ tá»•ng quÃ¡t lÃ : má»™t táº­p con Ä‘Ã³ng cá»§a má»™t complete space lÃ  complete.

Tuy nhiÃªn, khÃ´ng pháº£i má»i khÃ´ng gian Ä‘á»u complete. VÃ­ dá»¥, khoáº£ng má»Ÿ $(0,1)$ khÃ´ng complete. Má»™t pháº£n vÃ­ dá»¥ lÃ  dÃ£y $x_n = 1/n$ lÃ  Cauchy trong $(0,1)$, nhÆ°ng $\lim x_n = 0 \notin (0,1)$. BÃ i há»c á»Ÿ Ä‘Ã¢y lÃ  cÃ¡c khoáº£ng má»Ÿ khÃ´ng complete vÃ¬ chÃºng thiáº¿u cÃ¡c Ä‘iá»ƒm Ä‘áº§u mÃºt.

Má»™t vÃ­ dá»¥ quan trá»ng khÃ¡c vá» khÃ´ng gian khÃ´ng complete lÃ  $\mathbb{Q}$â€”táº­p há»£p cÃ¡c sá»‘ há»¯u tá»‰. ChÃºng ta cÃ³ thá»ƒ xÃ¢y dá»±ng má»™t dÃ£y cÃ¡c sá»‘ há»¯u tá»‰ há»™i tá»¥ Ä‘áº¿n $\sqrt{2}$. DÃ£y nÃ y lÃ  Cauchy trong $\mathbb{Q}$, nhÆ°ng giá»›i háº¡n $\sqrt{2} \notin \mathbb{Q}$. Váº­y $\mathbb{Q}$ khÃ´ng complete. Vá» máº·t lá»‹ch sá»­, completeness cá»§a $\mathbb{R}$ chÃ­nh lÃ  lÃ½ do táº¡i sao chÃºng ta â€œcáº§nâ€ sá»‘ thá»±câ€”chÃºng ta cáº§n má»™t khÃ´ng gian complete Ä‘á»ƒ lÃ m viá»‡c vá»›i giáº£i tÃ­ch.

Má»™t vÃ­ dá»¥ quan trá»ng trong giáº£i tÃ­ch hÃ m lÃ  khÃ´ng gian cÃ¡c hÃ m liÃªn tá»¥c $C([0,1], \mathbb{R})$ vá»›i uniform metric (supremum norm):

\[d_\infty(f,g) = \sup_{x \in [0,1]} |f(x) - g(x)|\]

Äá»‹nh lÃ½ phÃ¡t biá»ƒu ráº±ng $(C([0,1]), d_\infty)$ lÃ  complete. Ã tÆ°á»Ÿng chá»©ng minh: náº¿u $(f_n)$ lÃ  má»™t dÃ£y Cauchy, thÃ¬ nÃ³ lÃ  uniformly Cauchy. Äiá»u nÃ y cÃ³ nghÄ©a lÃ  vá»›i má»—i $x$, dÃ£y $(f_n(x))$ lÃ  Cauchy trong $\mathbb{R}$, vÃ  vÃ¬ $\mathbb{R}$ lÃ  complete, giá»›i háº¡n $f(x) = \lim f_n(x)$ tá»“n táº¡i. HÆ¡n ná»¯a, sá»± há»™i tá»¥ Ä‘á»u báº£o toÃ n tÃ­nh liÃªn tá»¥c, vÃ¬ váº­y $f$ lÃ  liÃªn tá»¥c vÃ  $f_n \to f$ Ä‘á»u. Completeness lÃ  ná»n táº£ng trong giáº£i tÃ­ch hÃ m.

Cuá»‘i cÃ¹ng, cÃ¡c khÃ´ng gian $\ell^p$ lÃ  complete cho má»i $p \geq 1$. ÄÃ¢y lÃ  cÃ¡c khÃ´ng gian cÃ¡c dÃ£y $(x_n)$ vá»›i $\sum x_n ^p < \infty$ vÃ  metric:
\[d((x_n), (y_n)) = \left(\sum_{n=1}^\infty |x_n - y_n|^p\right)^{1/p}\]

Chá»©ng minh lÃ  khÃ´ng táº§m thÆ°á»ng vÃ  sá»­ dá»¥ng báº¥t Ä‘áº³ng thá»©c Minkowski vÃ  Ä‘á»‹nh lÃ½ há»™i tá»¥ Ä‘Æ¡n Ä‘iá»‡u. Táº§m quan trá»ng cá»§a cÃ¡c khÃ´ng gian nÃ y lÃ  chÃºng táº¡o thÃ nh ná»n táº£ng cho giáº£i tÃ­ch hÃ mâ€”cÃ¡c Banach spaces.

3. Properties cá»§a Complete Spaces

Äá»‹nh lÃ½ 1 (Closed Subspace):
Y âŠ† X closed, X complete â‡’ Y complete (vá»›i induced metric).

Proof:
(yâ‚™) Cauchy in Y â‡’ Cauchy in X â‡’ yâ‚™ â†’ x âˆˆ X.
Y closed â‡’ x âˆˆ Y. âœ“

Corollary: [a,b] complete vÃ¬ closed in â„.

Äá»‹nh lÃ½ 2 (Converse):
Y âŠ† X, Y complete, X complete â‡’ Y closed trong X.

Proof:
Cho x âˆˆ cl(Y). âˆƒ sequence yâ‚™ âˆˆ Y: yâ‚™ â†’ x.
Convergent â‡’ Cauchy.
Y complete â‡’ yâ‚™ â†’ y âˆˆ Y.
Limits unique â‡’ x = y âˆˆ Y.
Váº­y cl(Y) = Y. âœ“

Ã nghÄ©a: Y complete âŸº Y closed (trong complete space).

Äá»‹nh lÃ½ 3 (Nested Closed Sets):
X complete, Fâ‚ âŠ‡ Fâ‚‚ âŠ‡ Fâ‚ƒ âŠ‡ â€¦ closed nonempty vá»›i diam(Fâ‚™) â†’ 0.
ThÃ¬ â‹‚Fâ‚™ = {exactly one point}.

Proof:
Chá»n xâ‚™ âˆˆ Fâ‚™. diam(Fâ‚™) â†’ 0 â‡’ (xâ‚™) Cauchy.
X complete â‡’ xâ‚™ â†’ x.
âˆ€n: tail {xâ‚™, xâ‚™â‚Šâ‚, â€¦} âŠ† Fâ‚™, Fâ‚™ closed â‡’ x âˆˆ Fâ‚™.
Váº­y x âˆˆ â‹‚Fâ‚™.
diam â†’ 0 â‡’ unique. âœ“

Application: Fixed point theorems, existence proofs.

4. Completion cá»§a Metric Spaces

Idea: Má»i incomplete metric space cÃ³ â€œcompletionâ€â€”complete space chá»©a X dense.

VÃ­ dá»¥: Completion cá»§a â„š = â„.

Äá»‹nh lÃ½ (Completion Theorem):
Má»i metric space (X, d) cÃ³ completion ((\overline{X}), (\overline{d})) unique up to isometry:

  • (\overline{X}) complete metric space
  • X âŠ† (\overline{X}) isometrically
  • X dense trong (\overline{X})

Construction:
(\overline{X}) = equivalence classes cá»§a Cauchy sequences trong X.
Two sequences equivalent if distance â†’ 0.

Proof: Technical nhÆ°ng straightforward. See Munkres Â§43.

Example:

  • Completion cá»§a â„š = â„
  • Completion cá»§a (0,1) = [0,1]
  • Completion cá»§a C([0,1]) vá»›i LÂ¹ = LÂ¹([0,1])

Uniqueness: Up to isometry preserving X.

ğŸ¯ Nowhere Dense Sets vÃ  Baire Category

1. Nowhere Dense Sets

KhÃ¡i niá»‡m nowhere dense lÃ  má»™t cÃ¡ch Ä‘á»ƒ Ä‘o lÆ°á»ng â€œÄ‘á»™ nhá»â€ cá»§a má»™t táº­p há»£p theo nghÄ©a tÃ´-pÃ´. Má»™t táº­p há»£p Ä‘Æ°á»£c gá»i lÃ  nowhere dense náº¿u closure cá»§a nÃ³ khÃ´ng chá»©a báº¥t ká»³ táº­p má»Ÿ nÃ oâ€”nghÄ©a lÃ  nÃ³ khÃ´ng â€œdÃ y Ä‘áº·câ€ á»Ÿ báº¥t ká»³ Ä‘Ã¢u.

Äá»‹nh nghÄ©a (Nowhere Dense):
Má»™t táº­p há»£p $A \subseteq X$ Ä‘Æ°á»£c gá»i lÃ  nowhere dense náº¿u $\text{int}(\text{cl}(A)) = \emptyset$.

NÃ³i báº±ng lá»i, closure cá»§a $A$ khÃ´ng chá»©a báº¥t ká»³ táº­p má»Ÿ nÃ o. Äiá»u nÃ y tÆ°Æ¡ng Ä‘Æ°Æ¡ng vá»›i viá»‡c $\text{cl}(A)$ khÃ´ng cÃ³ interior pointsâ€”khÃ´ng cÃ³ Ä‘iá»ƒm nÃ o trong closure cÃ³ má»™t lÃ¢n cáº­n má»Ÿ hoÃ n toÃ n náº±m trong closure. Trá»±c giÃ¡c lÃ  $A$ Ä‘Æ°á»£c â€œtráº£i má»ngâ€â€”nÃ³ khÃ´ng â€œdÃ yâ€ á»Ÿ báº¥t ká»³ Ä‘Ã¢u trong khÃ´ng gian.

Examples:

Example 1: {0} nowhere dense trong â„.
cl({0}) = {0}, int({0}) = âˆ…. âœ“

Example 2: â„• nowhere dense trong â„.
cl(â„•) = â„•, int(â„•) = âˆ…. âœ“

Example 3: Cantor set nowhere dense trong [0,1].
C compact, totally disconnected, perfect, measure zero.
cl(C) = C, int(C) = âˆ…. âœ“

Example 4: [0,1] NOT nowhere dense trong â„.
int(cl([0,1])) = int([0,1]) = (0,1) â‰  âˆ…. âœ—

Example 5: â„š NOT nowhere dense trong â„.
cl(â„š) = â„, int(â„) = â„ â‰  âˆ…. âœ—
(â„š dense!)

Proposition:
A nowhere dense âŸº X \ cl(A) dense.

Proof:
A nowhere dense âŸº int(cl(A)) = âˆ… âŸº cl(A) khÃ´ng chá»©a open ball nÃ o âŸº má»i open ball intersects X \ cl(A) âŸº X \ cl(A) dense. âœ“

Trá»±c giÃ¡c: Complement cá»§a nowhere dense = dense!

2. Category vÃ  Meager Sets

KhÃ¡i niá»‡m category lÃ  má»™t cÃ¡ch Ä‘á»ƒ phÃ¢n loáº¡i cÃ¡c táº­p há»£p theo â€œÄ‘á»™ lá»›nâ€ cá»§a chÃºng trong khÃ´ng gian tÃ´-pÃ´. Má»™t táº­p há»£p Ä‘Æ°á»£c gá»i lÃ  meager (hay first category) náº¿u nÃ³ cÃ³ thá»ƒ Ä‘Æ°á»£c viáº¿t thÃ nh há»£p Ä‘áº¿m Ä‘Æ°á»£c cá»§a cÃ¡c táº­p nowhere denseâ€”nghÄ©a lÃ  nÃ³ lÃ  â€œnhá»â€ theo nghÄ©a Baire.

Äá»‹nh nghÄ©a (Meager/First Category):
Má»™t táº­p há»£p $A$ Ä‘Æ°á»£c gá»i lÃ  meager (hay first category) náº¿u $A = \bigcup A_n$ vá»›i má»—i $A_n$ lÃ  nowhere dense.

Äá»‹nh nghÄ©a (Nonmeager/Second Category):
Má»™t táº­p há»£p $A$ Ä‘Æ°á»£c gá»i lÃ  nonmeager (hay second category) náº¿u nÃ³ khÃ´ng meager.

Äá»‹nh nghÄ©a (Residual/Comeager):
Má»™t táº­p há»£p $A$ Ä‘Æ°á»£c gá»i lÃ  residual (hay comeager) náº¿u $X \setminus A$ lÃ  meager.

Trá»±c giÃ¡c Ä‘áº±ng sau cÃ¡c khÃ¡i niá»‡m nÃ y lÃ : meager = â€œnhá»â€ (há»£p Ä‘áº¿m Ä‘Æ°á»£c cá»§a cÃ¡c táº­p má»ng), trong khi residual = â€œlá»›nâ€ (pháº§n bÃ¹ lÃ  meager). Äiá»u quan trá»ng cáº§n lÆ°u Ã½ lÃ  thuáº­t ngá»¯ â€œcategoryâ€ á»Ÿ Ä‘Ã¢y khÃ´ng liÃªn quan Ä‘áº¿n category theoryâ€”Ä‘Ã¢y lÃ  má»™t thuáº­t ngá»¯ lá»‹ch sá»­ tá»« cÃ´ng trÃ¬nh cá»§a Baire.

Examples:

Example 1: Countable sets meager trong â„.
â„š = â‹ƒ{râ‚™}, má»—i {râ‚™} nowhere dense â‡’ â„š meager. âœ“

Example 2: Cantor set meager trong [0,1].
C nowhere dense â‡’ meager. âœ“

Example 3: â„ \ â„š residual trong â„.
â„š meager â‡’ â„ \ â„š residual. âœ“

Surprise: â„š dense nhÆ°ng meager!
â„ \ â„š measure-theoretically full (measure = â„), also residual!

Lesson: â€œLargeâ€ cÃ³ nhiá»u meanings: dense, full measure, residual.

3. Baire Category Theorem

Äá»‹nh lÃ½ (Baire Category Theorem - Version 1):
Cho (X, d) complete metric space.
Náº¿u Uâ‚, Uâ‚‚, Uâ‚ƒ, â€¦ open dense trong X, thÃ¬:

\[\bigcap_{n=1}^\infty U_n \text{ dense trong } X\]

NÃ³i báº±ng lá»i: Countable intersection cá»§a open dense sets = dense.

Trá»±c giÃ¡c: â€œLarge sets stay large even after countable intersections.â€

Äá»‹nh lÃ½ (Baire Category Theorem - Version 2):
Complete metric space X khÃ´ng thá»ƒ viáº¿t Ä‘Æ°á»£c thÃ nh countable union cá»§a nowhere dense sets.

Equivalent formulation: Complete metric space = second category (nonmeager).

Proof cá»§a Version 1 â‡’ Version 2:
Giáº£ sá»­ X = â‹ƒ Aâ‚™, Aâ‚™ nowhere dense.
Uâ‚™ = X \ cl(Aâ‚™) open dense (by proposition).
â‹‚Uâ‚™ dense â‡’ â‹‚Uâ‚™ â‰  âˆ….
NhÆ°ng â‹‚Uâ‚™ = X \ â‹ƒcl(Aâ‚™) âŠ† X \ â‹ƒAâ‚™ = âˆ…. Contradiction! âœ“

Proof cá»§a Baire Category Theorem (Version 1):

Given: X complete, Uâ‚, Uâ‚‚, â€¦ open dense.
Goal: â‹‚Uâ‚™ dense, i.e., â‹‚Uâ‚™ âˆ© V â‰  âˆ… âˆ€ open V â‰  âˆ….

Construction:
Cho V open â‰  âˆ….

Step 1: Uâ‚ dense â‡’ Uâ‚ âˆ© V â‰  âˆ…, open.
Choose open ball Bâ‚ = B(xâ‚, râ‚) âŠ† Uâ‚ âˆ© V vá»›i râ‚ < 1.

Step 2: Uâ‚‚ dense â‡’ Uâ‚‚ âˆ© Bâ‚ â‰  âˆ…, open.
Choose Bâ‚‚ = B(xâ‚‚, râ‚‚) âŠ† Uâ‚‚ âˆ© Bâ‚ vá»›i râ‚‚ < 1/2.

Induction: Bâ‚™ = B(xâ‚™, râ‚™) âŠ† Uâ‚™ âˆ© Bâ‚™â‚‹â‚ vá»›i râ‚™ < 1/n.

Claim: (xâ‚™) Cauchy.
xâ‚™, xâ‚˜ âˆˆ Bâ‚™ (m > n) â‡’ d(xâ‚™, xâ‚˜) < 2râ‚™ < 2/n â†’ 0. âœ“

X complete â‡’ xâ‚™ â†’ x âˆˆ X.

Claim: x âˆˆ cl(Bâ‚™) âˆ€n.
Tail {xâ‚™, xâ‚™â‚Šâ‚, â€¦} âŠ† Bâ‚™ âŠ† cl(Bâ‚™). âœ“

râ‚™ â†’ 0 â‡’ cl(Bâ‚™) = {x} eventually?
No! NhÆ°ng x âˆˆ cl(Bâ‚™) âŠ† cl(Uâ‚™ âˆ© V).
Uâ‚™, V open â‡’ x âˆˆ Uâ‚™ âˆ© V.

Váº­y x âˆˆ (â‹‚Uâ‚™) âˆ© V. âœ“

Conclusion: â‹‚Uâ‚™ dense. âœ“ QED

Remark: Proof constructiveâ€”actually finds point in intersection!

4. Applications cá»§a Baire Category Theorem

Application 1: Existence cá»§a Continuous Nowhere Differentiable Functions

Äá»‹nh lÃ½ (Banach):
â€œMostâ€ continuous functions [0,1] â†’ â„ nowhere differentiable.

Precise: {f âˆˆ C([0,1]) : f nowhere differentiable} residual.

Proof idea: Baire Category + C([0,1]) complete.

Remark: Counterintuitive! â€œTypicalâ€ function NOT differentiable.

Application 2: Irrationality â€œTypicalâ€

Fact: â„ \ â„š residual trong â„.
Váº­y â€œalmost allâ€ real numbers irrational (trong Baire sense).

Note: Also true measure-theoretically (â„š measure zero).

Application 3: Hint at Open Mapping Theorem

Äá»‹nh lÃ½ (Open Mapping Theorem - functional analysis):
T: X â†’ Y continuous linear surjection giá»¯a Banach spaces â‡’ T open.

Proof sá»­ dá»¥ng Baire Category Theorem crucially.

Sketch:
Y = â‹ƒ T(Bâ‚™(0)). Baire â‡’ some T(Bâ‚™(0)) has interior â‡’ T open on origin â‡’ T open everywhere. âœ“

Application 4: Principle of Uniform Boundedness

Äá»‹nh lÃ½ (Banach-Steinhaus):
{Tâ‚™} linear operators pointwise bounded â‡’ uniformly bounded.

Proof: Baire Category.

ğŸ§  Fundamental Papers & References

Classic Works

  1. RenÃ© Baire - â€œSur les fonctions de variables rÃ©ellesâ€ (1899)
    Introduced category notion, proved Baire Category Theorem

  2. Stefan Banach - â€œSur les opÃ©rations dans les ensembles abstraitsâ€ (1922)
    Banach spaces, completeness

  3. Maurice FrÃ©chet - â€œSur quelques points du calcul fonctionnelâ€ (1906)
    Metric spaces

Textbooks

  2. Walter Rudin - Principles of Mathematical Analysis, Chapter 3

ğŸ”— Applications and Connections

Functional Analysis

Banach Spaces: Complete normed vector spaces. Baire â‡’ Open Mapping, Closed Graph, Uniform Boundedness.

Real Analysis

Existence Proofs: Baire shows certain objects â€œgenericâ€ (continuous nowhere differentiable functions).

Descriptive Set Theory

Polish Spaces: Complete separable metric spaces. Baire Category fundamental tool.

Differential Equations

Fixed Point Theorems: Banach Fixed Point Theorem requires completeness. Solve ODEs, PDEs.

Probability Theory

Kolmogorov: Completion of probability spaces ensures measurability.

ğŸ§© Exercises

Completeness

  1. Verify Completeness:
    Chá»©ng minh chi tiáº¿t [0,1] complete.

  2. Not Complete:
    Chá»©ng minh (0,1) khÃ´ng complete báº±ng explicit Cauchy sequence.

  3. Closed Subspace:
    Chá»©ng minh: Y closed in complete X â‡’ Y complete.

  4. Completion:
    TÃ¬m completion cá»§a â„š âˆ© [0,1].

Cauchy Sequences

  1. Cauchy:
    xâ‚™ = Î£áµ¢â‚Œâ‚â¿ 1/i!. Chá»©ng minh (xâ‚™) Cauchy trong â„.

  2. Not Cauchy:
    Cho example sequence khÃ´ng Cauchy.

  3. Product:
    X, Y complete â‡’ X Ã— Y complete (product metric)?

Nowhere Dense

  1. Verify Nowhere Dense:
    â„• nowhere dense trong â„. Chá»©ng minh.

  2. Cantor Set:
    Cantor set C nowhere dense, measure zero, nhÆ°ng uncountable, perfect. Sketch construction.

  3. Dense but Meager:
    â„š dense vÃ  meager trong â„. Explain paradox.

Baire Category Theorem

  1. Apply Baire:
    â„ khÃ´ng thá»ƒ viáº¿t thÃ nh countable union cá»§a countable sets. Chá»©ng minh báº±ng Baire.

  2. Irrationals Residual:
    â„ \ â„š residual. Explicit proof.

  3. Continuous Nowhere Differentiable:
    Research proof sketch (Banachâ€™s theorem) vá» existence.

Applications

  1. Fixed Point:
    Banach Fixed Point Theorem: f: X â†’ X contraction trÃªn complete X â‡’ unique fixed point.
    Sketch proof.

  2. Nested Sets:
    Ãp dá»¥ng nested closed sets theorem: solve equation báº±ng successive approximations.

Advanced

  1. Locally Compact:
    Locally compact Hausdorff space cÅ©ng satisfy Baire Category Theorem (khÃ´ng cáº§n complete!).
    Example: â„â¿, manifolds.

  2. Countable vs Meager:
    Countable set meager, nhÆ°ng meager set cÃ³ thá»ƒ uncountable (Cantor set).
    Explain sizes.

  3. Open Mapping:
    Research Open Mapping Theorem statement vÃ  proof sketch using Baire.

Reflection

  1. Why Completeness Matters:
    Explain táº¡i sao completeness crucial trong analysis.

  2. Baireâ€™s Surprise:
    Baire Category Theorem counterintuitive: â„š dense nhÆ°ng â€œsmallâ€ (meager), â„\â„š â€œlargeâ€ (residual).
    Reconcile intuition.
